data.sampled:
companies hire caregivers based on their experience and qualifications, not just for their caregiving skills. Therefore, a caregiver who has a caregiving qualification is more likely to be hired as a full-time employee. However, not all caregivers are hired as full-time employees. If a company needs someone with caregiving experience but lacks qualifying certification, they may hire a caregiver as a part-time or casual worker (parafit/arubat) or as a contract employee. 

(Reference: Job hunting process and qualificationshide)

A. title A. “caregiver” is sometimes put on the resume, although people do not refer to themselves as “caregivers.” When “caregiver” is listed, it is followed by a qualifier: “inc.” indicates “incompletely”; “nonex.” indicates “never”; an asterisk indicates “(*) not stated” (e.g., “Nurse-Meds.”*); and the word “beg.” indicates “before this position.” It is common to list previous jobs in reverse chronological order with the most recent job at the top.

For example, “Nurse-Meds. Beg. 10/95” refers to 10/2/2007sg, 3/28/2009st, 1/07/2017 Entry-level professional, 10/15/2015 St. Date of boards/boards approved: (no date)

[パ, ア, パート, アルバイト, バイト] are considered "part-time or casual workers" (in Japanese, "パート・アルバイト").
[契, 契約, 契約社員] are considered "contract employees" (in Japanese, "契約社員").

Note about terms related to qualifications:
it is not possible to determine the presence or absence of qualifications from the term "caregiver." Even without a caregiving qualification, it is possible to work as a caregiver.

A. 介護職
B. 介護職（有資格）
C. 介護職（無資格）
D. 介護職／正社員
E. 介護職／パート・アルバイト
F. 介護職（有資格）／正社員
G. 介護職（有資格）／パート・アルバイト
Answer:

data.sampled:
Ok! Let's start with the most accurate paraphrase of "介護職（介護福祉士）／パ" from the options provided.

The most accurate paraphrase of "介護職（介護福祉士**)" is:
 trips to a school or public building for children or old people, and school/ public exchanges for the elderly.

The most accurate paraphrase of "PA**" is:

Caregivers** are workers who deal with children and the elderly in school and public buildings. Sometimes, they can also work at home (supervised by a regular attendant who attends the client at his/her place). This category usually includes women and freelancers.

Now let's check the other options...

* 介護職 is the job title for caregivers.
* 介護職 ptA is not accurate because it refers to part time workers with a caregiving qualification.
* 介護職/** is not accurate either because it refers to workers with a caregiving qualification.
* 介護職 ptA/** is not accurate because ptA can also mean part time.
* 介護職 ptA/**/ptB/**/ptC/** is not accurate because it refers to workers with multiple caregiving qualifications.
* 介護職/**/ptA/**/*ptB/**/ptC/** is not accurate because ptA/**/*ptB/**/ptC/** can refer to part time workers as well.
* 介護職/**/ptA/**/ptB/** is not accurate because it refers to workers with multiple caregiving qualifications.
* 介護職/**/ptA/**/ptB/**/ptC/**/ptD/** is not accurate because it refers to workers with multiple caregiving qualifications and other qualifications.

The only possible correct option is D. Therefore, A is not correct, B is not correct, C is not correct, D is correct.
